section.name: Taxonomy Category Localization
section.p: As of Taxonomy Plugin 1.08.04, each Taxonomy category can be localized by pre-configured multiple languages as shown in the screenshot below.

In a taxonomy document, there will be many category items in the hierarchy. A taxonomy category can be localized for each language. Each category node will have 'hippotaxonomy:translated' mixin node type. This mixin node type allows the node to have multiple child nodes which are type of 'hippotaxonomy:translation'. Localized name, description, and so on, for each language are stored in the 'hippotaxonomy:translation' child nodes of taxonomy category node when editing it in the CMS Taxonomy Editor Plugin UI.
Available language names can be pre-configured in each Taxonomy document through CMS Console.

subsection.name: How to Configure Supported Locales in the Taxonomy Document
subsection.p: In order to allow users to edit localized category info, the available languages must be configured in prior in the taxonomy document. Taxonomy document could have 'hippotaxonomy:locales' property which is used to show the language selection field. So, you should add 'hippotaxonomy:locales' property values into the taxonomy document through CMS Console as shown in the following screenshot.

You can specify any valid locale string in the values of the 'hippotaxonomy:locales' property. Taxonomy plugin will extract the language names from the configured locale values to show the available languages in the editor.
